content: © gilly bettney 2008 version 1 2 l s b ittle tring ag the main body of the bag is done in the round so you ll need a stitch marker the finished size is approximately 20 cm/8 inches deep and 25 cm/10 inches wide un- stretched whilst the bag opening is 20 cm/8 inches in diameter the internal pocket is made first and attached to the bag as the bag is worked it measures approximately 9 cm/3 5 inches wide by 10 cm/4 inches deep you can change the size of your pocket by making it wider or deeper or even add in extra ones to suit your needs gauge is not important for this pattern so feel free to use whichever cotton yarn you have to hand materials techniques required 150g/300m patons 100% cotton dk chain stitch chain 1 button 15mm/ ½ inch diameter slip_stitch slip_stitch double_crochet double_crochet hook cord stitch 4mm/g cord stitch this is simply double_crochet that is crocheted from left to right with the right side facing and produces a lovely sturdy finish to your work if you have trouble with this stitch it can be replaced with a row of slip-stitches instead with either the right or the wrong side of your work facing page 1 of 5 © gilly bettney 2008 version 1 2 pocket 21 chain leaving a long end of yarn to use for sewing the pocket side with 1 right side 1 double_crochet into the second chain from the hook 1 double_crochet into each chain to end 1 chain turn 20 2 1 double_crochet into each 1 chain turn 20 3 repeat row 2 until the work measures 21-22 cm a total of approximately 51 row ending with the right side facing next row wrong side 1 double_crochet into next 10 7 chain 1 double_crochet into last 10 double_crochet 1 chain turn 20 n b these 7 chain forms the button loop you may need to make it larger or smaller depending on the yarn you are using and the size of the button you have chosen next row right side 1 double_crochet into each double_crochet of the previous row keep your work in front of the chain loop 1 chain turn see images below 20 forming the button loop last row 1 double_crochet into each 20 the finished button loop finish off leaving a long end for sewing fold the bottom edge of the pocket up so that it is just under the button loop sew down both sides of the pocket the pocket is now ready to be inserted into the bag don t forget to sew on your button place it on the front of the pocket ensuring the loop fits around it page 2 of 5 © gilly bettney 2008 version 1 2 bag 5 chain slip_stitch into the first chain to form a ring 1 6 double_crochet into the ring continue in spirals without joining each round 2 2 double_crochet in each double_crochet around 12
